text:
Ness City is a city in Ness County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Ness County. In 2010, 1,449 people lived there. Ness City is famous for its four-story Old Ness County Bank Building in downtown, and nicknamed "Skyscraper of the Plains".
History.
Ness City was created in 1878. The town grew a lot when a railroad was built there in 1886.
Geography.
Ness City is at (38.452250, -99.905989). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 1,449 people, 635 households, and 392 families living in Ness City.
